channel.title: UN News - Global perspective Human stories
channel.description: UN News - Global perspective Human stories | Europe

item.title: Rights experts urge UK to redraft controversial Northern Ireland bill
item.description: The United Kingdom should rewrite proposed legislation covering the 30-year conflict in Northern Ireland, known as the “Troubles”, because it fails to comply with the obligation to investigate serious violations and denies truth and remedy for the victims, two UN human rights experts said on Thursday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN emergency relief chief ends Ukraine visit, pledging solidarity
item.description: In Ukraine, the UN’s top emergency relief official on Thursday pledged solidarity with the embattled country and its people, as they try to rebuild their lives amid the ongoing war.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Winter’s downward spiral documented by UN agencies
item.description: Nine months after Russia invaded Ukraine, rural households are increasingly forced to scale down or abandon agricultural activities, according to a new survey released on Wednesday by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Countries must support resilient recovery to prevent ‘cascade’ of poverty, hunger
item.description: The war in Ukraine is a “relentless humanitarian nightmare” said the UN chief on Tuesday, warning that the death and destruction afflicting civilians there will take years to overcome, and rebuild.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine war: Attacks against civilians and infrastructure must stop, disarmament chief tells Security Council
item.description: The only way to end the suffering and devastation in Ukraine, “is by ending the war”, the UN’s top disarmament official told the Security Council on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN taps potential for trust-building on shared water resources
item.description: A UN-led push for greater cross-border cooperation over increasingly finite water resources, made significant progress on Thursday, after it was announced that more than 30 governments and organizations have decided to work together on the issue.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine’s suffering must not become new normal, declares UN rights chief
item.description: The suffering being experienced by millions of civilians across Ukraine must not become the new normal, the UN human rights chief said on Wednesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: ‘Senseless war’ has triggered ‘colossal torment’: Griffiths to Security Council
item.description: The torment being unleashed by Russia’s “senseless war”, on the people of Ukraine and beyond, is “colossal”, the UN Emergency Relief Coordinator told the Security Council on Tuesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Missile strikes threaten millions facing cold and hungry winter
item.description: A UN Spokesperson said on Monday that another wave of missile strikes in Ukraine has further damaged the country’s energy system, leaving millions of people without electricity and water as temperatures dip below freezing.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Fighting conflict-related sexual violence in Ukraine
item.description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has been described as a crisis for women and girls, with cases of conflict-related sexual violence on the rise. Hrystyna Kit, co-founder of JurFem, the Ukrainian Women Lawyers Association, has found herself pushing forward against a rising tide of gender-based violence.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Heading into winter without heat or water, needs in Mykolaiv are 'critical’
item.description: In the south of Ukraine, people have no water, electricity or heat, and food is scarce, the UN Spokesperson said on Monday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Missile strikes, summary executions highlight importance of international law
item.description: Amidst recent allegations of war prisoners being summarily executed in Ukraine, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk expressed his shock on Friday over unabated human suffering as Russian missile and drone strikes against critical infrastructure continue on a broad scale.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: ‘Catastrophic’ winter in store for Ukraine, warns UN peacebuilding chief, following Russian strikes on critical infrastructure
item.description: Addressing the Security Council on Wednesday, Rosemary DiCarlo, the UN Under-Secretary-General for Political and Peacebuilding Affairs, warned of the devastation caused by Russia’s “relentless attacks” against civilians and critical infrastructure across Ukraine.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Overnight blasts near Ukraine nuclear plant are ‘playing with fire!’ – UN nuclear chief
item.description: Powerful explosions shook the area of Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP), “abruptly ending a period of relative calm” at the facility, the head of the UN nuclear watchdog agency said on Sunday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: From the Field: In Ukraine, ‘I have grown used to the endless fear’
item.description: Living with fear and the daily threat of death is something that all Ukrainians have had to reckon with since Russia’s invasion of 24 February, and local UN staff are no exception.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine war: Risks of spillover ‘remain all too real’, Security Council hears
item.description: Some of the most intense bombardments in the war in Ukraine have occurred in recent days, UN political affairs chief Rosemary DiCarlo told the Security Council on Wednesday, warning against the risk of escalation and spillover into other countries.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukrainian and Russian POWs tortured and ill-treated: OHCHR
item.description: Prisoners of war on both sides of the conflict in Ukraine have told UN human rights investigators that they have been subjected to torture and ill-treatment while held captive.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: General Assembly adopts resolution on Russian reparations for Ukraine
item.description: The UN General Assembly on Monday adopted a resolution that calls for Russia to pay war reparations to Ukraine, as ambassadors met to resume their emergency special session devoted to the conflict.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: UN convoy delivers vital aid to residents of Kherson
item.description: Essential supplies have been delivered to thousands of people in the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson for the first time since Russia’s invasion of 24 February, UN humanitarians announced on Monday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: UN and partners provide life-saving aid to some 13.5 million
item.description: The United Nations and humanitarian partners are continuing to reach growing numbers of people impacted by the war on the ground with life-saving assistance, a UN spokesperson told journalists on Thursday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Türkiye: UN experts call for end to harassment of human rights defenders
item.description: Five UN-appointed independent human rights experts called on Tuesday for Türkiye to stop using counter-terrorism legislation to intimidate human rights defenders and to immediately release Sebnem Korur Fincancı, a senior medic and anti-torture expert.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Sweden: Step up efforts to fight systemic racism, urge UN experts
item.description: Sweden should step up efforts to fight systemic racism and focus on strategies to restore trust between police and minority groups, said a UN Human Rights Council-appointed group of independent experts on advancing racial justice and equality, on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Europe hotting up more than twice global average: WMO
item.description: Temperatures in Europe have increased at more than twice the global average over the past 30 years – the highest of any continent in the world. As the warming trend continues, exceptional heat, wildfires, floods and other climate change impacts will affect society, economies and ecosystems, according to a report released Wednesday by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO).
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN chief ‘deeply concerned’ by stalled Black Sea Grain Initiative
item.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres has expressed deep concern at Russia’s decision to suspend its involvement in the Black Sea Grain Initiative, a deal set up to reintroduce vital food and fertilizer exports from Ukraine to the rest of the world.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN chief reaffirms support for deals to ensure export food and fertilizer from Ukraine and Russia
item.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres has reaffirmed his “unwavering commitment” to agreements aimed at ensuring that grain and fertilizers from Ukraine and the Russian Federation reach global markets at the speed and price needed to avert a global food crisis and ensure food security.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN still sees no sign of biological weapons in Ukraine
item.description: The United Nations is not aware of any biological weapons programmes in Ukraine, a senior official in the Office for Disarmament Affairs (UNODA) reiterated on Thursday in a briefing to the Security Council.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UNDP to support refurbishment of damaged public buildings in Ukraine
item.description: A €2 million agreement between the European Investment Bank (EIB) and the UNDP Development Programme (UNDP), announced on Tuesday, will help restore damaged public buildings in Ukraine and contribute to recovery and reconstruction that is green, resilient, and inclusive.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: ‘Undeniable need for accountability’ in Ukraine as violations mount
item.description: The Independent Commission of Inquiry on Ukraine, presented its first detailed written report to the UN General Assembly on Tuesday, which concludes that there are reasonable grounds to believe “an array” of war crimes, violations of international human rights and humanitarian law have been committed.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Surge in poverty-stricken children in Eastern Europe, Central Asia
item.description: Rising inflation and the Ukraine war have triggered a 19 per cent increase in child poverty across Eastern Europe and Central Asia, according to a study by the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF), published on Monday, the International Day for the Eradication of Poverty.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: UN General Assembly demands Russia reverse course on ‘attempted illegal annexation’
item.description: The UN General Assembly passed a resolution by a large majority on Wednesday, calling on countries not to recognise the four regions of Ukraine which Russia has claimed, following so-called referendums held late last month, and demanding that Moscow reverse course on its "attempted illegal annexation".
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories
